Class BJBeetle

java.lang.Object
  BJBeetle

public class BJBeetle
extends java.lang.Object

A Robot Beetle. This version is adapted from an earlier one, to work better in BlueJay. It can only turn through right angles.

Version:
22/8/02
Author:
Ann Robertson

Method Detail

moveBackward

public void moveBackward(int distance)
Calculates the new position reached by moving backward

Parameters:
distance - is the distance to move

moveForward

public void moveForward(int distance)
Calculates the new position reached by moving forward

Parameters:
distance - is the distance to move

setPenUp

public void setPenUp(boolean up)
Sets the penUp attribute

Parameters:
up - If the value is true the pen will be up and will not draw. If the value is false the pen will go down and will draw.

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String theTitle)
Allows the user to set a title for the drawing

Parameters:
theTitle - The text for the title.

start

public void start()
Draw a beetle at the default start position. That is in the middle facing up with the pen down.

start

public void start(int theXPos,
                  int theYPos,
                  java.lang.String theDirection,
                  boolean isUp)
Allows the user to set a starting position.

Parameters:
theXPos - The distance from the left edge of the beetle's space.
theYPos - The distance from the top of the beetle's space.
theDirection - A string: "North", "South", "East" or "West".
isUp - Whether the pen is up (true) or down (false)

turnLeft

public void turnLeft()
Changes the direction attribute by 90 degrees to the left

turnRight

public void turnRight()
Changes the direction attribute by 90 degrees to the right
